text: Daniel Graham (March 31, 1942 – February 19, 2022) was an American visual artist, writer, and curator. He wrote art theory essays and reviews of rock music. He was known for his video performance art through glass and mirror installation art and closed-circuit television. Daniel is author of films Two Correlated Rotations (1969), Roll (1970), and Body Press (1970–72). Graham died on February 19, 2022 in New York City at the age of 79.Dan Graham, Conceptual Artist Who Bent Time and Space, Dies at 79 Graham's first solo show was held in 1969 at the John Daniels Gallery in New York. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American essayists Category:American painters Category:American art critics Category:Artists from Illinois Category:Writers from Urbana, Illinois
